Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge correctly applied the residency requirement under the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed days of physical presence in Canada but provided insufficient evidence; expired passport covering relevant period was destroyed without justification; other documents were inconclusive
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Citizenship Judge's decision
Defendant_Behavior: Destroyed expired passport without adequate justification
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to meet 1095-day physical presence requirement within four years
Legal_Standard: Physical presence test: strict day-counting, qualitative assessment, or centralization of mode of existence
Assessment_Factor: Credibility and sufficiency of evidence regarding residency
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under the Federal Courts Act
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to Citizenship Judge's decision
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's evidence deemed insufficient and unreliable due to lack of key documentation
Legal_Provision_Cited: Requirement of 1095 days of physical presence in Canada within four years
Application_Basis: Citizenship application based on residency eligibility
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Destruction of expired passport and lack of corroborating evidence
Outcome: Application for citizenship denied; judicial review dismissed
Harm_Assessment: No harm established due to failure to prove legal eligibility
Cause_Description: Applicant's destroyed expired passport and lack of corroborating evidence led to uncertainty about his residency days
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section of Citizenship Act regarding 1095-day physical presence requirement
Evidence_Issues: Missing primary evidence, lack of verification for claimed residency days
Legal_Provision: Citizenship Act - Residency Requirement (1095 days in 4 years)
Evidence_Assessment: Judge reasonably concluded that evidence did not support residency claim
Decision_Rationale: Insufficient and uncorroborated evidence to establish required physical presence
Evidentiary_Issues: Destruction of critical document (passport), lack of alternative reliable records
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard in judicial review; physical presence test under Citizenship Act
